com.zoiper.zdk

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zoiper.zdk.Context

  • public class Context
extends java.lang.Object
    ZDK's main entry point

      • libraryVersion

        public java.lang.String libraryVersion()
        Get the ZDK version Get the revision of the ZDK's source last commit.
        Returns:
        The revision as an ASCII string.

      • startContext

        public Result startContext()
        Initialize the ZDK Create all internal structures, protocol stacks, network transports and event queues. It will test the available audio devices. It will spawn necessary processing threads. You must call stopContext to close the network transports, stop all threads and free all structures. Do not call this function more than once in a row - use stopContext to clean up and then you can call startContext again.
        Returns:
        Result of the initialization
        See Also:
        Result

      • stopContext

        public Result stopContext()
        Destroys the ZDK Closes network transports, terminates worker threads and frees all structures. You can call startContext after this to re-open the library. This is a blocking call and will always take some time to finish but has a hard-limit of 2 seconds for IAX and 4 seconds for SIP which in the worst case means 6-7 seconds with some additional time for thread synchronisation.
        Returns:
        Result of the initialization
        See Also:
        Result

      • addProtocol

        public Result addProtocol(ProtocolType proto,
                          int port)
        Creates a call manager instance for a protocol Creates a call manager instance for a specific protocol. Protocol MUST be added before creating accounts using it! Will be automatically destroyed by stopContext. Some call managers are automatically created by startContext. SIP cannot be created by this function.
        Parameters:
        proto - Protocol
        port - Port at which to bind the main socket
        Returns:
        Result of the addition
        See Also:
        Result

      • testSIPURI

        public Result testSIPURI(java.lang.String sipUri)

      • setStatusListener

        public void setStatusListener(ContextEventsHandler value)
        Configures the context event listener The set listener will be notified for each event.
        Parameters:
        value - The context event listener to be added
        See Also:
        ContextEventsHandler

      • networkChanged

        public Result networkChanged()
        Notify the ZDK for changed network event Handles the network change event - resets the DNS, re-register users, refreshes active calls, etc. Each invocation restarts a timer delaying the execution of the handling with 500ms from the last received event - if invoked more then once in the delay period, the handling will happen 500ms after the last call.
        Returns:
        Result of the invocation
        See Also:
        Result

      • forceNativeCrash

        public void forceNativeCrash(int delayMs)
        Force native crash Forces a native crash to take place.
        Parameters:
        delayMs - Delay in milliseconds. If 0 - crashes immediately!
